Testing: Testing how the models do with the same prompt and stimuli as the original study but with new controls (to test if they really understand the logical connectives or not). (testing if they can identify weird interpretations of logical connective)
Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: If I remember correctly, John doesn’t drink wine or beer.
NOR: The doctor has forbidden him alcohol.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: It’s cold in this house. I bet you, John didn’t close the window or the back door.
NAND: I wonder which one of those two we’ll find open.
NOR: Look, just as I said, both of them are wide open!
Positive AND: So, look, both the window and back door are closed.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: If I remember correctly, Mary didn’t invite John or Suzi to her birthday party.
NAND: I don’t know which of them.
NOR: She’s upset with both of them and doesn’t want to see them.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: John is upset. Clearly, he didn’t pass the semantics or the syntax exam.
NOR: And it wouldn’t be the first time he failed those classes.
Positive AND: So he got an A on both tests.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: My grandmother made these cookies without rum or cinnamon.
NOR: Instead of those ingredients she added homemade brandy.
Positive AND: So the cookies tasted like rum and cinnamon.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: John went on holiday without his mother or his father.
NOR: It's the first time he travels by himself.
Positive AND: So he took them both on vacation because it's their anniversary.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Peter told me he needed to travel light. To judge by the small size of his bag, he was travelling without his computer or his movie camera.
NAND: I wonder which of the two he decided to give up.
NOR: I am sure he was a lot happier without electronic devices.
Positive AND: So his bag had both his computer and movie camera in it when I looked.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Kate used to live without coffee or chocolate.
NOR: Now she cannot imagine her life without them.
Positive AND: So she used to buy a lot of lattes and chocolate chip cookies.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Few people took the appetizer or the dessert.
NOR: The main dish was already expensive.
Positive AND: So both were gone by the end of the night.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Apparently, few people are able to recite back a sequence of twelve letters or twelve numbers.
Positive AND: So most people are able to recite twelve numbers in a row.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: John doubts that Sue played football or tennis.
NAND: He thinks she focused on one of the two.
NOR: He thinks she never did any ball sports.
Positive AND: So he thinks she did both.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Mary doubts that Paul read The Brothers Karamazov or Anna Karenina.
NAND: She thinks he had time for only one of them.
NOR: She thinks he never reads Russian literature.
Positive AND: So she knows he's read all the classics of Russian literature.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Some of the students speak English well, but not all of them.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: Two of the suspects were caught yesterday, but no names have been released yet.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: They shut down some museums after the attacks. But I don’t know which ones.

Instructions: On a scale of 1 to 7, 1 being very unnatural and 7 being very natural, rate how natural the following sentence(s) is:
Proposition: John saw two performances by this artist. He thinks he is the best opera singer he ever listened to.
